intro: Diosma robusta, commonly known as the robust diosma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Diosma robusta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
